column4: do any of the gstreamer plugins allow Ryhthmbox to play wmas? If so , which one?
Have you tried UbuntuGuide ?
yep
Tried play the file with totem ?
not yet. I'm just trying to get all the default programs to work nicely first
gstreamer (or any Linux MPs in existence) cannot play DRM-ed WMAs
yeah, these aren't DRMed
did you try it with mplayer ?. Can't all WMAs you have be played ?
yes, i can play them in mplayer
media format supports in Edgy is pretty clunky compared to Feisty, but WMA is entirely possible, can you pastebin all the gstreamer packages you have installed ?
well i'm just installing ffmeg now, so i'll tell you how that works out
all -good/bad/ugly and their -multiverse counterpart should be installed. You'll no longer have to worry about playing any of them.
it's taking a while - have massive packet loss to the US today
take your time. Btw, Feisty is in a stable state to use daily. My uptime is 7 days without a hitch now.
heh, my best freebsd box uptime is 124 days ... have to reboot soon though ...
yeah, but anything more than 1 week uptime is considered suitable for desktop daily use, IMO.
yes, of course ... i just wanted to brag about uptime ;)
you beat me to it :p the longest I've had is around 60 days.

ok, ffmpeg didn't do it, so i'll install the rest of the gstreamer plugins and see how I go. I should just stick with xmms (which i usually use) but i really want to get it working in Ryhthmbox for once :)
heh we have a solaris box at work that has been up for almost 3 years .. i kid not
and the convenient preview feature of nautilus.
not really extraordinary for a real server, but I have a laptop. 60 days without kernel updates is not quite good.
exactly
that's why the freebsd server is getting rebooted soon
